intro: Didiscus pilosus var. typicus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves covered in fine, velvety hairs. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its hairy foliage and robust growth make it a common weed in agricultural fields and disturbed habitats.
